reviews.text: I love the lift presentation. They are stairs too. When I went down the stairs I was like “Street Level is here.” Then, it had a tunnel that reminds me of an underground station. It’s beautiful. After that is a really nice presentation of a ticket office. Then you get to street level which is right by the toilets of the station. So you don’t have to go in to access the toilets. Instead, you exit and get to the first step of street level. I love the station and I wasted 5 minutes of your time making you read this. Sorry! LOL
Very.  Helpful. .  AND. POLITE.  STAFF. WHO. . HAVE. THE. STATION. AND. ENTRANCE. VERY. CLEAN. AND. TIDY. .

Old Roan station is on the Northern Line where trains depart for Ormskirk and Liverpool. Bus stops are adjacent to the station for onward travel to the surrounding area.
The platforms are on a raised elevation with many steps to access them. However, lifts are also available. A toilet is situated next to the ticket office.
